Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to punish the people from different areas. This is because they did not follow the rules in the past. Every year, they choose one boy and one girl from each area. The children are 12 to 18 years old. These chosen children are called 'tributes'. The tributes must fight in a battle. Only one person can stay alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on television.

The original text states the children are chosen 'by lottery', but your output omits this crucial detail. The sentence structure is simple, but the vocabulary and factual errors make this a clear failure.

Text saved: The Hunger Games happen every year. The government uses the games to show people what happens when they break the rules. This is because people did not follow the rules in the past. Every year, one boy and one girl are chosen from each area by lottery. This means their names are picked by chance. The children are between 12 and 18 years old. These chosen children are called 'tributes'. This is the special name for the children who must fight. They must fight each other until only one person is alive. Everyone in the country has to watch the games on TV.

metadata.feedback_text: FAILED. The text repeatedly uses the passive voice, which is unacceptable for the A2 level. The sentences 'one boy and one girl are chosen', 'their names are picked by chance', and 'These chosen children are called 'tributes'' are all grammatically too complex. An A2 text must use simple, active sentences. For example, instead of 'one boy and one girl are chosen', use 'The government chooses one boy and one girl'. This fundamental structural error makes the text a failure despite good vocabulary simplification.
